Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh are hopeful of skipper Shakib Al Hasan getting fit in time for their upcoming ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 match against India on October 19, 2023, at the Maharashtra Cricket Association (MCA) stadium in Pune.
Shakib Al Hasan suffered a slight quadricep tear during the Bangladesh-New Zealand match in Chennai but continued to play through the pain.
Team director Khaled Mahmud mentioned that Shakib is getting better and is pain-free, but his fitness will be assessed during the practice session in Pune.
Shakib Al Hasan participated in a swimming session and some upper-half work in the gym, and a scan will be conducted to get a clearer picture of his situation.
Khaled Mahmud emphasized that Shakib's inclusion in the match against India depends on his 100% fitness, and they do not want to risk him for the rest of the tournament.
